thread.title: Iris Prize festival gets underway in Cardiff
thread.title_full: Iris Prize festival gets underway in Cardiff | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Iris Prize festival gets underway in Cardiff
text:
The Iris Prize Festival, one of the biggest celebrations of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender film, will begin this evening in Cardiff.
An image from just one of the short films which will feature in this year's Iris Prize Festival Credit: Iris Prize Now in its ninth year, the five-day event will feature short films made by directors from destinations across the globe including Norway, the Netherlands, India, Australia, Israel, Ireland, Denmark, Germany, and the USA.
Each film will hope to be in with a chance of winning the Â£30,000 Iris Prize - an award decided by an independent jury.
Another of the short films which will feature in the 2015 Iris Prize Festival Credit: Iris Prize As the festival coincides with this year's Rugby World Cup, organisers have decided to kick-off the opening night with a documentary following the journeys of three men competing in the Bingham Cup, an international gay rugby union tournament.
For more information on the festival and how to get involved, visit the Iris Prize website.
Last updated Wed 7 Oct Cardiff
